senses.de: To cause or persuade to enter, especially to take part in a particular activity
senses.ex: The company brought in a new director.

Tips.title: New Participation
Tips.description: Used when someone is invited to join an activity or group with a specific role.
Tips.example: Let's bring in an expert to lead our workshop.

Tips.title: Refreshing Dynamics
Tips.description: It suggests adding fresh ideas or perspectives to a group or situation.
Tips.example: We need to bring in some young talent to revitalize the team.

senses.de: To earn or gain, especially money or profit
senses.ex: The movie brought in millions at the box office.

Tips.title: Profitable Attraction
Tips.description: Highlights earning money, not just steady income, but substantial profit.
Tips.example: The new product line is expected to bring in considerable profits.

Tips.title: Financial Success
Tips.description: Used when a project or venture generates financial gain.
Tips.example: Our investment strategy managed to bring in high returns last quarter.

senses.ex: Farmers bring in the crops during fall.

Tips.title: End of Season
Tips.description: Refers to gathering crops or results at the end of a growing or working period.
Tips.example: It's time to bring in the wheat before the weather turns bad.

Tips.title: Harvest Time
Tips.description: Emphasizes the action of collecting agricultural produce after growth.
Tips.example: Farmhands are busy bringing in the fruit from the orchards.

senses.de: To present or introduce something or someone to others
senses.ex: We had to bring in new evidence to prove our point.

Tips.title: Presenting Evidence
Tips.description: Implies showing new information or proof in an argument or case.
Tips.example: The lawyer brought in new testimonies to strengthen the defense.

Tips.title: Sharing Ideas
Tips.description: Bringing in can be about offering new concepts or plans for consideration.
Tips.example: In the meeting, they brought in some innovative ideas for the campaign.

senses.de: To involve someone or something in a particular situation
senses.ex: We had to bring in the authorities to handle the situation.

Tips.title: Requesting Assistance
Tips.description: Signals calling for help or intervention from someone with authority or expertise.
Tips.example: When the negotiations failed, they brought in a mediator.

Tips.title: Involve Experts
Tips.description: Used when expertise is required to deal with a complex issue.
Tips.example: The project's complexity meant we had to bring in specialists.
